summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing technical issues and procurement concerns regarding the NICEVision video surveillance system at multiple Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) facilities. The emails reveal internal criticism of the system's cost and performance, with suggestions of potential financial waste or impropriety.

events.title: NICEVision Administrator Database Error
events.description: A user at FCI Otisville reports a 'Database Error' when trying to log into the NICEVision Administrator to unlock an account, causing the application to close. They seek help from other facilities.

events.title: Internal Criticism of NICEVision Procurement
events.description: Multiple BOP facility staff exchange emails criticizing the NICEVision system as 'junk,' questioning why a $350K system was approved when cheaper alternatives (Avigilon for $50K less, a $30-35K upgrade) were available, and suggesting someone in D.C. may have corrupt financial motives ('pockets lined').

keyFacts: BOP staff at multiple facilities were experiencing technical failures with the NICEVision surveillance system in August 2019.
Internal emails suggest the $350,000 NICEVision system was significantly more expensive than available alternatives, including an Avigilon system said to be $50,000 cheaper.
One email alleges potential corruption, stating 'some one in D.C. has their pockets lined by NICE.'
The correspondence reveals internal dissent and questions about procurement decisions within the Bureau of Prisons.
The document is marked as potentially containing SENSITIVE information for official use only.
